page.title: 03HODGEMOOR WOODS,SEER GREEN.
page.content: On Thursday 11th July we went to Hodgemoor Woods which is owned by the Forestry Commission with 31 byelaws made in 1982.There are horse tracks marked with a horseshoe and footpaths marked with a white arrow or circle. There are lots of different trees;oaks with acorns and sycamores with seeds called helicopters.There are elders and when the berries are ripe,you can make elderberry wine.There are silver birches,holly,rowans,hazels which have nuts in the winter and larches which have cones.The conifers are evergreen except for the larch which is deciduous. There is a small plantation of beech trees and the trees are about 3 metres apart.
